merger_description:
ServiceNow, Inc. (ServiceNow) proposes to acquire Armis Security, Ltd (Armis).

ServiceNow is a US-based software company. ServiceNow primarily supplies enterprise software which brings together data, artificial intelligence (AI), company processes, assets and security into a single platform that employees can use for a range of purposes. ServiceNow’s products facilitate organisation workflows by turning fragmented operations into coordinated, autonomous workflows. These types of software products are known as ‘IT operations management’ or ITOM products. ServiceNow also supplies Operational Technology (OT) operations management (OTOM) products, which improve visibility, health, and serviceability of industrial systems in OT environments, including by enabling incident response and operational resilience. ‘OT’ describes technology that interacts directly with physical equipment like utility grids, industrial machinery or healthcare equipment.

Armis is a US-based software company specialising in cyber exposure management and security. Armis’ products help organisations see, protect and manage all points through which an unauthorised user could access a system and extract data. Armis’ products work across cyber-physical system environments, primarily focused on OT security. Armis provides a range of security products under its Armis Centrix platform, including products for Asset Management and Security, OT/IoT (Internet of Things) Security (SaaS and On-Premise), Secure Remote Access, Medical Device Security and Early Warning.

Both ServiceNow and Armis supply products that have:

* continuous threat exposure management (CTEM) capabilities for IT environments, and
* OT security solution capabilities.
